thread.title: Iron ore price leaps 4pc to climb above $US55 a tonne
thread.title_full: Iron ore price leaps 4pc to climb above $US55 a tonne | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The Advertiser

author: Daniel Palmer
title: Iron ore price leaps 4pc to climb above $US55 a tonne
text:
THE price of iron ore has again surged above $US55 a tonne, with the latest gains all but making up for the heavy losses seen at the start of last week.
At the end of the latest session, benchmark iron ore for immediate delivery to the port of Tianjin in China was trading at $US55.50 a tonne.
That is up 4.1 per cent from $US53.30 a tonne in the previous session.
The commodity tumbled at the start of last week, with losses amid Monday's rout on markets coming in as the most extreme in weeks.
Concerns around slowing Chinese growth were at the heart of the weakness, though the curbing of steel mill activity near Beijing for a World War II parade as well as BHP Billiton's downgrade to peak steel output expectations also put a cap on the commodity's price.
There remains concerns about the demand impact of a push to temporarily reduce air pollution in Beijing as steel mills and other facilities near the capital will be closed from August 28 to September 4.
For now, however, iron ore has enjoyed a two-session rally as panic around the Chinese economy fades. As of the latest close, the commodity is just US20c shy of a seven-week high.
 Iron ore price surges 4pc
